thread.title: Greater Manchester Police forced to deny they trolled Manchester City fans ahead of their Champions League clash with Monaco
thread.title_full: Greater Manchester Police forced to deny they trolled Manchester City fans ahead of their Champions League clash with Monaco

author: rforrester
title: Greater Manchester Police forced to deny they trolled Manchester City fans ahead of their Champions League clash with Monaco
text:
EFL Cop a load of this Greater Manchester Police forced to deny they trolled Manchester City fans ahead of their Champions League clash with Monaco 
Police hinted that Manchester United were the bigger club after their recent Europa League match set to attract more crowds By Richard Forrester Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments GREATER Manchester Police have been forced to deny that they purposely trolled Manchester City fans on social media. 
Pep Guardiola’s side host AS Monaco in the first-leg of their Champions League last-16 encounter on Tuesday night. AS Monaco at Man City on Tues night for those who need a bit more time to plan. Not expected to be as busy as St Etienne, but you never know 
— GMP City Centre (@GMPCityCentre) February 17, 2017 PA:Press Association 2 Saint-Etienne’s supporters created an unbelievable atmosphere at Old Trafford 
It will be the second time in less than a week that Manchester has welcomed thousands of visitors after United hosted Saint Etienne for their Europa League clash on Thursday. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Manchester City news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary. 
The rowdy French visitors were given a police escort through the city meaning all main roads through the city centre and Salford were shut. 
And ahead of City’s upcoming clash, Manchester Police took to Twitter to warn the public of further travelling issues whilst hinting that City won’t attract as many fans as their fierce rivals. 
They wrote: “AS Monaco at Man City on Tues night for those who need a bit more time to plan. 
“Not expected to be as bust as St Etienne, but you never know.” 
United fans took this as the perfect opportunity to poke fun at their noisy neighbours which one user commenting, “will be more Monaco fans than city fans anyway.” French supporters flooded the streets of Manchester before the game related articles Preview Fulham vs Tottenham: When is the FA Cup game on, what TV channel is it on and what is the latest team news? Back to the Future Michael Keane can be like Paul Pogba at Manchester United, says Rio Ferdinand 'He needs to show more' Spurs boss Mauricio Pochettino tells Vincent Janssen to get his act together or become a flop Team News Wolves vs Chelsea team news: John Terry set for Blues return Team News Millwall vs Leicester City team news: Leicester to rest big guns with one eye on the Champions League 'How's my English?' Juventus boss Max Allegri stokes flames that he is in line to replace Arsenal boss Arsene Wenger Preview Wolves vs Chelsea: When is the FA Cup game on, what TV channel is it on and what is the latest team news? Clatt's a problem Mark Clattenburg will not be the only referee to leave the Premier League, claims Richard Keys 'Artwarming Joy for Bournemouth star Harry Arter and partner Rachel as they welcome baby after stillbirth tragedy that made him the target of troll Preview Millwall vs Leicester: When is the FA Cup game on, what TV channel is it on and what is the latest team news? MARK UP! Sutton warn touts trading in gold-dust £600 Arsenal cup tickets that cards are marked and police involved Up for the Cup FA Cup fifth round LIVE - Minnows Lincoln City travel to Burnley before Huddersfield host Man City Insp S – you may not believe me, but I absolutely wasn't trolling City fans! It was about fewer away fans expected to travel…honestly!! 
— GMP City Centre (@GMPCityCentre) February 17, 2017 
Another wrote: “A red copper having a sly dig at the city fans, that’s what I like to see.” 
However three hours later the police insisted their tweet was aimed at trolling City fans. 
The twitter account with 88,000 followers added: “you may not believe me, but I absolutely wasn’t trolling City fans! It was about fewer away fans expected to travel… honestly!!”. St Etienne fans light and throw flares onto the pitch against Manchester United
